text: Bottle. Sour lemon/milk, biscuit malt, and lemon peel/grass aroma. Hazy yellow with nice white head. Moderately sweet passion fruit/pineapple/orange, biscuit malt, and mildly bitter lemon peel/grass flavor. Okay body.

Crisp, and ever so slightly hazy golden coloured body with a thinnish, single centimetre tall pure white head and a few bubbles rising from the bottom. Aroma of grass, cream, alcohol, sugars, cardboard and a very sweet, syrupy and citrus scent. Light-bodied; Mellow and herbal flavours at first with a big dose of bread and yeast along with some lighter malts and a touch of apples and pear sweetness. Aftertaste shows some very mellow hop notes, a bit of the grain and cardboard maltiness and a finish of sweetness from fruit with no hops at all. Overall, a decent beer, with no real perceived dry hopping, except some grassy hop notes, but they seem more intense and probably during the boil. I sampled this twelve ounce bottle purchased from Meijer in Woodhaven, Michigan on 08-December-2016 for US$16,99 for the mixed twelve pack, sampled at home in Washington on 26-April-2017.
Bottled. Tropical hop aroma. Initial bitterness subsides to a nice light malty taste. A very good lager!

Pour from a 12oz bottle. Slightly cloudy earthy yellow with medium head and good lacing. Nice aroma dominated by tropical fruit notes. taste is a very nice biuscuity malt with a tropical fruit hops up front that works well with the sweet malt. Finish is tropical fruit plus a little earth. really tasty lager.

Bottle - the pour is cloudy and a Sandy blond color with a medium thick head. The aroma is clean, hops, a little lemon rind. The taste is slightly grape, a good hop backbone but not strong hop forward. A good crisp ale.

Bottle. Tropical fruit aroma with cracker malt and mild citrus notes. Pours cloudy pale golden colored with a thin white head that has poor retention and good lacing. Starts with bright, sweet tropical fruit hop flavors with light cracker malt. Finishes smooth with tropical fruit sweetness continuing with a touch of light crackery maltiness. Light bodied and refreshing lager. Good stuff.

12 oz bottle. Pours hazy bright yellow with a big fluffy white head that retains well and leaves some lacing.

The aroma is crisp malt with fruity piney hops.

The flavor is bready malt with some sweet fruity hops with a little resin. The mouthfeel is medium bodied with low carbonation.

Overall, a nice hoppy lager.
bottle. golden with one finger head. light body with a bit of cracker, fruity tropical hop flavors. low bitterness. pretty solid for the style with a bunch of flavor.

12 ounce bottle into lager glass, bottled on 7/11/2016. Pours slightly hazy gol,den straw color with a 1 finger dense and rocky white head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts. Nice dense soapy lacing clings down the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of big grapefruit, tangerine, lemon/orange peel, pineapple, peach, citrus rind, light pepper, pine, cracker, bread, and floral/grassy earthiness. Very nice aromas with good balance and complexity of citrus/pine hops and light-moderate pale malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big grapefruit, tangerine, lemon/orange peel, citrus rind, light pepper, pine, cracker, bread, and floral/grassy earthiness. Light-moderate pine/citrus peel bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of grapefruit, tangerine, lemon/orange peel, citrus rind, light pepper, pine, cracker, bread, and floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a short bit. Very nice complexity, robustness and balance of citrus/pine hops and light-moderate pale malt flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance, and zero astringent hop flavors after the finish. Very clean on lager flavors, with zero yeast notes present. Medium carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, crisp, dry, and lightly grainy/sticky balanced mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 5.2%. Overall this is a great pale lager! All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of citrus/pine hops and light-moderate pale malt flavors; very smooth, crisp, clean, and refreshing to drink. I would guess Chinook or Columbus on the hop variety. A very enjoyable offering.
Bottle. Aroma is tropical fruit with mild sweet malt. Tastes like tropical fruit, nuts and cracker malt. Decent. No idea on the hops.
Bottle. Pours a light gold with a white head Mild citrus hops and light malt in the aroma and taste. Centennial?
